alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 3:35PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Ongoing snowmelt and reductions in reservoir releases will keep the river near to below minor flood stage. For the Mainstem Walker River near Mason at Snyder Lane...elevated levels are forecast to continue. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by other multiple causes continues. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.8 feet, Flood Stage, Minor lowland flooding begins throughout Mason Valley-Yerington area, with some inundation of lowlands and rural roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:20 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.7 feet late this afternoon. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Mason Bridge and Miller Lane remain closed. Additional information is available at cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon.
